intro: Micromeria biflora var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of theApiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "villosa." Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and bloom in early spring. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
